1.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
1.str2: To remain, abide, stay, wait; with acc: I wait for, await. A primary verb; to stay.
Brotherly love, love of Christian brethren. From philadelphos; fraternal affection.

2.str2: Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

2.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
2.str2: To forget, neglect. Middle voice from epi and lanthano; to lose out of mind; by implication, to neglect.
Love to strangers, hospitality. From philoxenos; hospitableness.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

2.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
2.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
2.str2: (a) I entertain a stranger, (b) I startle, bewilder. From xenos; to be a host; by implication, be strange.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb, which is used only as an alternate in certain tenses; to lie hid; often used adverbially, unwittingly.

3.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
3.str2: To remember, call to mind, recall, mention. A prolonged form of mnaomai; to remind, i.e. to recall to mind.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
One bound, a prisoner. From desmon; a captive.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

3.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: From sun and deo; to bind with, i.e. be a fellow-prisoner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Plural
3.str2: To treat evilly, hurt, torment. From a presumed compound of kakos and echo; to maltreat.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

3.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
3.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

3.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
3.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

4.str2: A marriage, wedding, wedding-ceremony; plur: a wedding-feast. Of uncertain affinity; nuptials.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From keimai; a couch; by extension, cohabitation; by implication, the male sperm.
Undefiled, untainted, free from contamination. Unsoiled, i.e. pure.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

4.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.
A fornicator, man who prostitutes himself. From pernemi; a prostitute, i.e. a debauchee.
An adulterer, that is, a man who is guilty with a married woman. Perhaps a primary word; a paramour; figuratively, apostate.

5.str2: From the same as trope; a turn, i.e. mode or style; figuratively, deportment or character.

5.word: free from the love of money
5.str2: Not loving money, not avaricious. Unavaricious.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
5.str2: To keep off, assist; I suffice; pass: To be satisfied. Apparently a primary verb; properly, to ward off, i.e. to avail.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

5.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Neuter Plural
5.str2: From para and eimi; to be near, i.e. At hand; neuter present participle time being, or property.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

5.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

5.str2: Probably a fuller form of rheo; an alternate for epo in certain tenses; to utter, i.e. Speak or say.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Singular
5.str2: From ana and hiemi; to let up, i.e. slacken or desert, desist from.

5.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

5.str2: From en and kataleipo; to leave behind in some place, i.e. let remain over, or to desert.

5.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
5.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

6.str2: So that, therefore, so then, so as to. From hos and te; so too, i.e. Thus therefore.

6.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
6.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
6.str2: To be courageous, confident, of good cheer. Another form for tharseo; to exercise courage.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

6.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
6.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A helper. From boe and theo; a succorer.

6.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 1st Person Singular
6.str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.

6.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
6.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

6.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

6.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
6.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

7.str2: From a derivative of mneme; to exercise memory, i.e. Recollect; by implication, to punish; also to rehearse.

7.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

7.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

Today, now. Neuter of a presumed compound of the article ho and hemera; on the day; generally, now.

19.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
19.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
More swiftly, more quickly. Neuter singular of the comparative of tachus; more swiftly, i.e. more rapidly, or more speedily.

20.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Blood, literally, figuratively or specially; by implication, bloodshed, also kindred.
From aion; perpetual.
From diatithemai; properly, a disposition, i.e. a contract.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
20.str2: From ana and ago; to lead up; by extension to bring out; specially, to sail away.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.

20.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
20.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A shepherd; hence met: of the feeder, protector, and ruler of a flock of men. Of uncertain affinity; a shepherd.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.

21.parse: Verb - Aorist Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: From kata and a derivative of artios; to complete thoroughly, i.e. Repair or adjust.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary word; 'good'.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
(a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
21.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
An act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires. From the prolonged form of ethelo; a determination, i.e. choice or inclination.

21.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
21.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
21.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Acceptable, well-pleasing (especially to God), grateful. From eu and arestos; fully agreeable.
Neuter of a compound of en and a derivative of optanomai; in the face of.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

21.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Dative Masculine Singular
21.str2: Who, which, what, that.
From the base of dokeo; glory, in a wide application.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as aei; properly, an age; by extension, perpetuity; by implication, the world; specially a Messianic period.
Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

22.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
22.str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

22.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: To endure, bear with, have patience with, suffer, admit, persist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

22.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
22.str2: To write, send by letter to. From epi and stello; to enjoin, i.e. to communicate by letter.

22.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Short, little, few. Of uncertain affinity; short.

23.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
23.str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to 'know' in a great variety of applications and with many implications.

23.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
23.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Timothy, a Christian of Lystra, helper of Paul. From time and theos; dear to God; Timotheus, a Christian.

23.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
23.str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

23.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular

23.str2: More swiftly, more quickly. Neuter singular of the comparative of tachus; more swiftly, i.e. more rapidly, or more speedily.

23.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
23.str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

23.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
23.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

24.str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.

24.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

24.str2: (a) To lead, (b) To think, be of opinion, suppose, consider.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Italy. Probably of foreign origin; Italia, a region of Europe.

24.str2: To greet, salute, pay my respects to, welcome. To enfold in the arms, i.e. to salute, to welcome.
